dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Jeff Bezos just pledged to export 10.5 billion dollars in Made In India goods by 2026.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Jeff Bezos just pledged to export ten point five billion dollars in Made In India goods by twenty twenty six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he made that announcement at the Amazon Sambhava event—it's a two-day summit for business owners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he made that announcement at the Amazon Sambhava event-it's a two-day summit for business owners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But the timing is interesting, um, because India's antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the timing is interesting, um, because India's antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indias antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for predatory pricing and preferential listing toward its favored brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for predatory pricing and preferential treatment of certain sellers. And there were protests in 250 cities against Amazon during his visit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for predatory pricing and preferential treatment of certain sellers. And there were protests in two hundred fifty cities against Amazon during his visit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Further, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized business owners organized protests in 300 cities across the country against Amazon to coincide with the billionaires visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's definitely a tricky environment. The government's been tightening e-commerce rules to protect local businesses from foreign competition.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's definitely a tricky environment. The government's been tightening e-commerce rules to protect local businesses from foreign competition.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Indian government has also spent the last year tightening its e-commerce regulations toward foreign online retailers, including rules to stop heavy discounting, in a bid to protect domestic competitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Bezos is trying some soft diplomacy—like visiting the Raj Ghat memorial for Gandhi and flying kites with teens.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Bezos is trying some soft diplomacy-like visiting the Raj Ghat memorial for Gandhi and flying kites with teens.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has posted videos on social media of himself paying respects at the Raj Ghat, a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in New Delhi, and flying kites with teenagers while in India.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He even called the 21st century the "Indian century" and emphasized an alliance between India and the U.S.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He even called the twenty first century the Indian century and emphasized an alliance between India and the U.S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a video posted to Instagram, Bezos ended his Amazon Shbhav speech with two declarations regarding India: I predict that the 21st century is going to be the Indian century. In this 21st century, the most important alliance is going to be the alliance between India and the United Statesthe worlds oldest democracy and the worlds largest democracy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But he hasn't announced any meeting with Prime Minister Modi, which is… notable, given Modi's own economic goals.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But he hasn't announced any meeting with Prime Minister Modi, which is... notable, given Modi's own economic goals.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos, the richest man in the world, has not made any announcements about meeting with Prime Minister Narenda Modi.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Modi wants India to hit 5.1 trillion dollars in GDP by 2025, up from 2.6 trillion in 2018. Bezos's pledge could help with that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Modi wants India to hit five point one trillion dollars in G D P by twenty twenty five, up from two point six trillion in twenty eighteen. Bezos's pledge could help with that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024. Indias GDP in 2018 was $2.6 trillion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Though Modi's also facing criticism for his policies toward Muslims, so, uh, it's a complicated relationship for any foreign investor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Though Modi's also facing criticism for his policies toward Muslims, so, uh, it's a complicated relationship for any foreign investor.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And Amazon declined to comment on specifics of the trip, which suggests they're being very careful here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And Amazon declined to comment on specifics of the trip, which suggests they're being very careful here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: An Amazon spokesperson declined to comment on the specifics of the India trip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Still, that export pledge is huge—if they can actually deliver on it amid all this regulatory pressure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, that export pledge is huge-if they can actually deliver on it amid all this regulatory pressure.

artist_script:
An Amazon summit in New Delhi, where Jeff Bezos makes a major announcement.
HostA: Jeff Bezos just pledged to export 10.5 billion dollars in Made In India goods by 2026.
HostB: Right, and he made that announcement at the Amazon Sambhava event—it’s a two-day summit for business owners.
HostA: But the timing is interesting, um, because India’s antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart.
HostB: Yeah, for predatory pricing and preferential treatment of certain sellers. And there were protests in 250 cities against Amazon during his visit.
HostA: It’s definitely a tricky environment. The government’s been tightening e-commerce rules to protect local businesses from foreign competition.
HostB: And Bezos is trying some soft diplomacy—like visiting the Raj Ghat memorial for Gandhi and flying kites with teens.
HostA: He even called the 21st century the "Indian century" and emphasized an alliance between India and the U.S.
HostB: But he hasn’t announced any meeting with Prime Minister Modi, which is… notable, given Modi’s own economic goals.
HostA: Modi wants India to hit 5.1 trillion dollars in GDP by 2025, up from 2.6 trillion in 2018. Bezos’s pledge could help with that.
HostB: Though Modi’s also facing criticism for his policies toward Muslims, so, uh, it’s a complicated relationship for any foreign investor.
HostA: Absolutely. And Amazon declined to comment on specifics of the trip, which suggests they’re being very careful here.
HostB: Still, that export pledge is huge—if they can actually deliver on it amid all this regulatory pressure.
